intro: Hebeclinium costaricense, commonly known as the Costa Rican hebeclinium, is a flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Costa Rica. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Hebeclinium costaricense is adapted to humid, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions with high rainfall.
